Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of entitlement to sit in judgement of other local community for the way it judges moral values. How about giving other nations sufficient respect to love and develop their own culture, without first having to meet US approval.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area with spikes with feeding tubes going all over the place and several skeletons and bodies half eaten. So what are they living with and more importantly who or what is killing them? Worth watching, good plot and character build.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to more enjoyable Disney fairy tales, thanks to the heavy stress of the 1950s and 60s for films of that type. The good points are a few catchy songs, a certain freshness looking the story with the found lost princess and an interesting character design that differ a lot

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy share their excesses (even with bugs) for fun at lavish dinner parties at the resort island of the wealthy.
